resources.string: TimeTracker helps you record the amount of time you spend on activities; for example, for recording time in a time sheet at work. It provides ways to view, edit, and filter times, and provides a time sheet report as well.

Create some tasks using the main task view's Add Task menu item. Tap a task to start timing; tap it again to stop timing, or tap a different task to switch timing to the other task. Two tasks can not be running at the same time. Use the Change View menu item to filter the time display by a date range, such as viewing times for Today, Yesterday, This Week, etc. Use the Report menu item to view a report of the daily time sums per task for an entire week.
The task context menu allows you to edit tasks (change their names), delete tasks (including all of the time history for that task!), or view the time log for that task.

The time log for a task is filtered on the same range that you selected for the main task view, so if you filtered the task view for This Week and you open the time log, then you'll only see times for this week. Use the Add Time to manually insert times into the time log. Note that TimeTracker will not prevent you from creating times that overlap with times in other (or the same) task. Use the context menu for a time to edit the time range, or simply click on a time to do the same thing. The context dialog for a time also includes the option of deleting the time.
You can visit http://ditz.germane-software.com/TimeTracker to see a list of known bugs and future enhancements.
The TimeTracker application icon was borrowed from the excellent glyFX icon library by PerthWeb Pty Ltd (www.glyfx.com).
